channel.title: [6-18-2014] [803] How to spawn Items/ Objects
channel.description:
[center][size=18pt]Hello and welcome to the Amvoverwizzle Guide[/size][/center] [center][URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/22222_zps8b736c69.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/22222_zps8b736c69.png[/img][/URL][/center] [center]This will teach you how to spawn Items and Objects in RS3[/center]
[center][size=14pt]Other Tutorials[/size]:
[6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 1 - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662912.0.html
[6-17-2014] [803] How to fix RS3 Weapon Icons - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662947.0.html
[6-19-2014] [809] How to Run latest cache in Server - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,663007.0.html
[/center]
[center][size=14pt]Lets start![/size][/center]
[size=14pt]How to spawn Items:[/size]
[size=14pt]Step 1:[/size] When you are in your RS3 server you are going want to open the Console command. To do this we are going Press and hold 2 button on the keyboard witch are [size=12pt]Alt + ~[/size] and if you ever decide you want to close the console do the same thing [size=12pt]Alt + ~[/size] but we want it open for what we are going be doing.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/1_zps61b6a5f1.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/1_zps61b6a5f1.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 2:[/size] You are going want to type item. This tells you that you are wanting to spawn a item.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/2_zps99cb9679.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/2_zps99cb9679.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 3:[/size] This is were you are going put the Item ID you want. The Item ID is the item that will be spawned.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/3_zps614ac8c7.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/3_zps614ac8c7.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 4:[/size] This is telling you how many you want, you can only spawn so much. If you are spawning a noted item that has a number you can do many. If you are spawning a non noted item you will only be able to spawn 28 items depending on your inventory space.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/4_zpsd28e790e.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/4_zpsd28e790e.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 5:[/size] Now lets put our item in. This will spawn us a Malevolent Body for us to wear and look cool.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/5_zpse4a0aeba.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/5_zpse4a0aeba.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 6:[/size] If you done everything corectly you will have this item in your inventory. Just click to wear it and well la you now know how to spawn items. There are 31143 Item's in this current build have fun.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/6_zps9799f241.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/6_zps9799f241.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]How to spawn Objects:[/size]
[size=14pt]Step 1:[/size] This is going to tell you that you want a object to spawn. You can either type obj or object
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/7_zpscea9df7a.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/7_zpscea9df7a.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 2:[/size] This is were you will be placing the Object ID
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/8_zps363c2875.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/8_zps363c2875.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 3:[/size] Now we are going to spawn our Object by putting the following in the Console Command.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/9_zps99aaabdf.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/9_zps99aaabdf.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 4:[/size] If you done correctly this should be under you
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/10_zpsc007666f.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/10_zpsc007666f.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 5:[/size] Now if you did not want that Item to be placed were you stand then type this command and it will get rid of it from that spot.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/11_zpsbd8f6fb9.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial%202/11_zpsbd8f6fb9.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 6:[/size] If you accidentally walked off of it or walked away from it but want to remove it now or later you will have to walk back onto / into it and then press obj 0. Some times you cant just walk back in it by right clicking the area and pressing walk to. You have to try keep moving around till you slip back in.
[size=18pt]Thank you for reading my guide on how to spawn Items/ Objects. If you have any questions please leave a comment and check out the other tutorials that I have done. If you use this in your server please leave me credit[/size]

item.title: [6-18-2014] [803] How to spawn Items/ Objects
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:12, topic:544069”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=662949.msg4435169#msg4435169 date=1404847377]

I think you deserve tutorial author badge because all your tutorials n stuff are always at the best level of detail even though they are set to the most derpyist things.

I think you deserve the most retarded suggestion ever badge.

I wouldn’t mind, a badge is a badge.

If a book author made a book even if it was explained in great details and 1000 pages long doesn’t mean it will be a good book. The tutorials have to be of some quality to get tutorial badge and this one really doesn’t teach us anything significant.

Just because you didn’t learn nothing new

Isn’t tutorial author all about how well you can spoon feed?

Not particularly, I wrote something like 22 spoon feeding website design and development tutorials and I don’t see me with a tutorial author badge.
[/quote]
I’m pretty sure the badge applies to the tutorial section. You’ve got the web developer badge because you were posting in the web developer section. I doubt I’ll get a badge for spoon-feeding people in help section or whatever.[/quote]
Nope, a tutorial is a tutorial regardless. The badge is given out on the relevancy of the tutorials to RS, the knowledge and state of the code and how well the tutorial is received throughout the community usually.

Sauce: ex-staff dealt with nominations n shet

Read full topic

item.title: [6-18-2014] [803] How to spawn Items/ Objects
item.dc:creator: @amvoverwizzle amvoverwizzle
item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

[center][size=18pt]Hello and welcome to the Amvoverwizzle Guide[/size][/center]
[center][URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/22222_zps8b736c69.png.html][/URL][/center]
[center]This will teach you how to spawn Items and Objects in RS3[/center]

[center][size=14pt]Other Tutorials[/size]:

[6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 1

  • https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662912.0.html

[6-17-2014] [803] How to fix RS3 Weapon Icons

  • https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662947.0.html

[6-19-2014] [809] How to Run latest cache in Server

  • https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,663007.0.html

[/center]

[center][size=14pt]Lets start![/size][/center]

[size=14pt]How to spawn Items:[/size]

[size=14pt]Step 1:[/size]
When you are in your RS3 server you are going want to open the Console command. To do this we are going Press and hold 2 button on the keyboard witch are [size=12pt]Alt + ~[/size] and if you ever decide you want to close the console do the same thing [size=12pt]Alt + ~[/size] but we want it open for what we are going be doing.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/1_zps61b6a5f1.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 2:[/size]
You are going want to type item. This tells you that you are wanting to spawn a item.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/2_zps99cb9679.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 3:[/size]
This is were you are going put the Item ID you want. The Item ID is the item that will be spawned.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/3_zps614ac8c7.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 4:[/size]
This is telling you how many you want, you can only spawn so much. If you are spawning a noted item that has a number you can do many. If you are spawning a non noted item you will only be able to spawn 28 items depending on your inventory space.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/4_zpsd28e790e.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 5:[/size]
Now lets put our item in. This will spawn us a Malevolent Body for us to wear and look cool.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/5_zpse4a0aeba.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 6:[/size]
If you done everything corectly you will have this item in your inventory. Just click to wear it and well la you now know how to spawn items. There are 31143 Item’s in this current build have fun.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/6_zps9799f241.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]How to spawn Objects:[/size]

[size=14pt]Step 1:[/size]
This is going to tell you that you want a object to spawn. You can either type obj or object

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/7_zpscea9df7a.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 2:[/size]
This is were you will be placing the Object ID

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/8_zps363c2875.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 3:[/size]
Now we are going to spawn our Object by putting the following in the Console Command.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/9_zps99aaabdf.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 4:[/size]
If you done correctly this should be under you

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/10_zpsc007666f.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 5:[/size]
Now if you did not want that Item to be placed were you stand then type this command and it will get rid of it from that spot.

[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial%202/11_zpsbd8f6fb9.png.html][/URL]

[size=14pt]Step 6:[/size]
If you accidentally walked off of it or walked away from it but want to remove it now or later you will have to walk back onto / into it and then press obj 0. Some times you cant just walk back in it by right clicking the area and pressing walk to. You have to try keep moving around till you slip back in.

[size=18pt]Thank you for reading my guide on how to spawn Items/ Objects. If you have any questions please leave a comment and check out the other tutorials that I have done. If you use this in your server please leave me credit[/size]

Read full topic
